name: Suburban scenes
description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

key_work.title: Lisa McCune's TV Week Logie awards
key_work.brief_description: These Logies recognise Lisa McCune’s work as Constable Margret Doyle on the series Blue Heelers (1994-2006). Netting her four golden Logies and ten overall, the character was praised as one of the strongest parts of the show. The episode in which Margret is killed, One More Day, is considered one of the best of the series and a landmark moment in Australian television. The part propelling her to stardom, McCune later enjoyed success in Sea Patrol (2007–2011), another series by Blue Heeler co-creator Hal McElroy, in addition to numerous other roles in various TV shows and films.

start.title: Body Melt
start.creator_credit: Philip Brophy, Daniel Scharf, Rod Bishop, 1 for Dumb Films, Australian Film Commission and Film Victoria
start.brief_description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug.

end.title: Bigger Than Life
end.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Mary Wills, Louis R. Loeffler, James Mason, 20th Century Fox, Cyril Hume and Richard Maibaum

video_links.name: Bigger Than Life (1956) | The Criterion Collection Trailer

end.brief_description: When a friendly, successful suburban teacher and father is prescribed cortisone for a painful, possibly fatal affliction, he grows dangerously addicted to the experimental drug, resulting in his transformation into a psychotic and ultimately violent household despot.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

links.description: Nicholas Ray’s Bigger Than Life also inspects medicine and suburbia, albeit with less slime and blood. The film probes the darker side of the often-idealised 1950s family home, with James Mason’s father character lashing out against his wife and son due to the psychological side effects of a miracle drug.

start.title: Bigger Than Life
start.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Mary Wills, Louis R. Loeffler, James Mason, 20th Century Fox, Cyril Hume and Richard Maibaum

video_links.name: Bigger Than Life (1956) | The Criterion Collection Trailer

end.title: Blue Velvet
end.creator_credit: David Lynch, Duwayne Dunham, Fred C. Caruso, DEG and Patricia Norris
end.brief_description: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of criminals who have kidnapped her child.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

links.description: Considered a spiritual protégé of Nicholas Ray by numerous critics, David Lynch dug into the dark underbelly of the idyllic American suburb in Blue Velvet. The film’s wide-eyed protagonist, Jeffery Beaumont, voyeuristically peers into the criminal world of his seemingly innocent hometown of Lumberton.

start.title: Blue Velvet
start.creator_credit: David Lynch, Duwayne Dunham, Fred C. Caruso, DEG and Patricia Norris
start.brief_description: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of criminals who have kidnapped her child.

end.title: Rear Window [DVD]
end.brief_description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

links.description: Decades before Blue Velvet, Alfred Hitchcock also investigated how suburbia can make voyeurs of us all in his 1954 classic Rear Window. Trapped in his home due to a broken leg, L.B. Jefferies watches the lives of his neighbours play out through his apartment window, eventually convincing himself that one of them has committed a murder.

start.title: Lisa McCune's TV Week Logie awards
start.brief_description: These Logies recognise Lisa McCune’s work as Constable Margret Doyle on the series Blue Heelers (1994-2006). Netting her four golden Logies and ten overall, the character was praised as one of the strongest parts of the show. The episode in which Margret is killed, One More Day, is considered one of the best of the series and a landmark moment in Australian television. The part propelling her to stardom, McCune later enjoyed success in Sea Patrol (2007–2011), another series by Blue Heeler co-creator Hal McElroy, in addition to numerous other roles in various TV shows and films.

end.title: Blue Heelers
end.brief_description: Blue Heelers is an Australian police drama series which depicted the lives of police officers stationed at the fictional Mount Thomas police station in a small town in Victoria.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

links.description: Lisa McCune’s work on Blue Heelers was recognised several times by the TV Week Logie Awards: her role as Const. Margret Doyle netting her ten awards in total, with four of them being Golden Logies.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

links.description: Featuring an early role from McCune, Philip Brophy’s 1993 cult classic Body Melt views both Australian suburbia and the health industry through a gory, slimy lens.
